5.4.19  8:41 pm   what is inside a rock

     rock

5.4.19  8:40 pm   how many key changes are there in "the moon is made of cheese but i can't taste it"?

     let's see, starts in B, then for "crazy" i'd call that a switch to Ab, then back to B (that's 2 changes so far). Remind me etc. would be from key of Db, then from World was younger is from A, so that's 2 more changes there. TV on radio is definitely from Db, then around Stereo/leaves, we're in Bb, then landing on Turquoise we're back in B, so that's 3 more changes. 'Fly around on an airplane' sounds like it would be part of a song in E, then 'business class sec' would be in G, so that's 2 more changes. ants crawl is still G, then the next chord i could make a case for either E, A, or D, but regardless it's definitely a change. then B (turtles.) then on "streets" i would argue Db. and just linearly up from there (Eb, then F, then G.). so that's 6 more changes. then somewhere in the midst of 'church holds the key' it slips into C, so that's 1 more change. Then it goes to garbage land on the last line in the chords, but, the melody is still in C so i don't call that a change. so that's 16 changes if i counted correctly, according to what i think counts as a key change. using for sure 9 different keys, at least

5.3.19  4:04 pm   thank you for reminding me that doing "bad work" can be fun. i think i'm often afraid that i won't enjoy working on a song if it's not the best thing ever to me but i forget that some of my best ideas come from when i stop trying not to be bad and just have fun with it, then suddenly bam it becomes actually good, but then if i start thinking about how good it is too much then my next thought is usually, shit maybe this sucks actually. as you can see i still have work to do on embracing my creative badness

     that cycle sounds like a normal day to me

5.3.19  3:00 pm   What's the difference between 2/4 and 4/4? I know 2/4 is like DAH dah DAH dah... etc and 4/4 is like DAH dah dah dah DAH dah dah dah... etc but you could easily count the ands in 2/4 and have it pretty much the same as 4/4. Sometimes I think maybe a song is in 2/4 but I feel like it could just as easily be in 4/4.

     in the modern world, 4/4 is the default setting, and usually you would only need 2/4 for a moment if there are really an odd number of 2/4 bars. so if you are in 2/4 but everything happens in an even number of bars, then you'd probably just use 4/4. unless you really want all your bars to appear half the size of what people are used to seeing
